24.verse: And I will be very angry and kill you ·in war [with the sword]. Then your wives will become widows, and your children will become orphans.

25.verse: “If you lend money to one of my people who is poor, do not treat him as a ·moneylender [creditor] would. ·Charge him nothing for using your money [Take no interest; Lev. 25:36–37; Deut. 23:19; Ps. 15:5].

26.verse: If your neighbor gives you his coat as ·a promise for the money he owes you [collateral], you must give it back to him by sunset,

27.verse: because his coat is the only cover to keep his body warm. He has nothing else to sleep in. If he cries out to me for help, I will ·hear [or act], because I am ·merciful [gracious; compassionate].

28.verse: “You must not ·speak against [revile; trifle with; disrespect] God or curse a leader of your people.

29.verse: “Do not hold back your offering from the first of your harvest and the first wine that you make. Also, you must give me your firstborn sons.

30.verse: You must do the same with your ·bulls [oxen] and your sheep. Let the firstborn males stay with their mothers for seven days, and on the eighth day you must give them to me.

31.verse: “You are to be my ·holy [consecrated; sanctified; set-apart] people. You must not eat the meat of any animal that has been ·killed [torn up] by wild animals. Instead, ·give [throw] it to the dogs.

1.verse: Laws About Fairness - “You must not ·tell lies [give a false report]. If you are a witness in court, ·don’t help [you shall not set hands with] a wicked person ·by telling lies [with a false/violent/malicious witness].

2.verse: “You must not ·do wrong just because everyone else is doing it [follow the crowd in evil]. ·If you are a witness in court, you must not ruin a fair trial. You must not tell lies just because everyone else is [You are not to give testimony in an accusation by siding with everyone else in order to distort justice].

3.verse: ·If a poor person is in court, you must not take his side just because he is poor [You must not be partial to a poor person in his dispute/lawsuit].

4.verse: “If you ·see [encounter] your enemy’s ox or donkey wandering away, you must return it to him.

5.verse: If you see that ·your enemy’s donkey [the donkey of one who hates you] has fallen because its load is too heavy, do not leave it there. You must ·help your enemy get the donkey back on its feet [set it free; or rearrange its load].

6.verse: “You must not ·be unfair to [pervert the justice of] a poor person when he is in court.

7.verse: ·You must not lie when you accuse someone in court [Keep yourself far from a false charge/report]. Never allow an innocent or honest person to be put to death as punishment, because I will not ·treat guilty people as if they were innocent [acquit the guilty].

8.verse: “You must not accept ·money from a person who wants you to lie in court [a bribe], because ·such money will not let you see what is right [a bribe blinds officials; Prov. 15:27; 17:8; 18:16]. Such money ·makes good people tell lies [undermines the cause of the righteous].

9.verse: “You must not ·mistreat [oppress] a ·foreigner [sojourner; resident alien]. You know how it feels to be a ·foreigner [sojourner; resident alien], because you were ·foreigners [sojourners; resident aliens] in Egypt [22:21].

10.verse: Laws for the Sabbath - “For six years you are to ·plant [sow] and harvest crops on your land.

11.verse: Then during the seventh year, ·do not plow or plant your land [you will let it lie fallow and untilled]. If any food grows there, allow the poor people to have it, and let the wild animals eat what is left. You should do the same with your vineyards and your orchards of olive trees [Lev. 25:1–7].

12.verse: “You should work six days a week, but on the seventh day you must ·rest [stop]. This lets your ox and your donkey rest, and it also lets the slave born in your house and the ·foreigner [sojourner; resident alien] be refreshed.

13.verse: “Be sure to do all that I have said to you. You must not ·even say [invoke; bring to mind] the names of other gods; those names must not ·come out of [be heard from] your mouth.

14.verse: Three Yearly Feasts - “Three times each year you must ·hold a feast to honor me [hold a festival; or make a pilgrimage for me].

15.verse: You must celebrate the ·Feast [Festival] of Unleavened Bread [34:18] in the way I commanded you. For seven days you must eat ·bread that is made without yeast [unleavened bread] at the set time during the month of Abib [13:4], the month when you came out of Egypt. No one is to ·come to worship [appear before] me ·without bringing an offering [empty-handed].

16.verse: “You must celebrate the ·Feast [Festival] of Harvest [called Feast of Weeks in 34:22; later called Pentecost]. Offer to God the first things you harvest from the crops you planted in your fields. “You must celebrate the ·Feast [Festival] of Ingathering [later called Feast of Shelters or Booths; Lev. 23:33–36] in the fall, when you gather all the crops from your fields.

17.verse: “So three times during every year all your males must come ·to worship [before] the LORD God.

18.verse: “You must not offer ·animal blood [blood of a sacrifice] along with anything ·that has yeast in it [leavened]. “You must not save any of the fat from the sacrifice for the next day.

19.verse: “You must bring the best of the firstfruits of your land to the ·Holy Tent [House; 25:9] of the LORD your God. “You must not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk [probably a pagan ritual; Deut. 14:21].

20.verse: God Will Help Israel - “I am sending an angel ahead of you, who will ·protect [guard] you ·as you travel [on the way/path]. He will ·lead [bring] you to the place I have prepared.

21.verse: Pay attention to him and ·obey him [listen to his voice]. Do not ·turn [rebel] against him; he will not forgive ·such turning against him [it] because my ·power [name] is in him.

22.verse: If you listen carefully to ·all he says [his voice] and do everything that I tell you, I will be an enemy to your enemies. I will fight all who fight against you.

23.verse: My angel will go ahead of you and take you into the land of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hivites, and Jebusites, and I will ·destroy them [wipe/blot them out].

24.verse: “You must not bow down to their gods or ·worship [serve] them. You must not live the way those people live. You must ·destroy their idols [demolish them], breaking into pieces ·the stone pillars they use in worship [their pillars].

25.verse: If you worship the LORD your God, ·I [he] will bless your bread and your water. I will take away sickness from you.

26.verse: None of your women will miscarry or be ·unable to have children [barren]. I will ·allow you to live long lives [fill the number of your days].

27.verse: “I will ·make your enemies afraid of me [send the dread of me before you]. I will confuse any people ·you fight against [against whom you come], and I will make all your enemies ·run away from [turn their backs to] you.

28.verse: I will send ·terror [or pestilence; or the hornet] ahead of you that will force the Hivites, Canaanites, and Hittites out of your way.

29.verse: But I will not ·force all those people out [drive them out] in only one year. If I did, the land would become ·a desert [desolate] and the wild animals would become too many for you.

30.verse: Instead, I will ·force those people [drive them] out ·slowly [little by little], until there are enough of you to ·take over [possess] the land.

31.verse: “I will give you the land from the ·Red [or Reed; 10:19] Sea to the ·Mediterranean [Philistine] Sea, and from the ·desert [wilderness] to the ·Euphrates River [River]. I will give ·you power over [into your hand] the people who now live in the land, and you will ·force [drive] them out ahead of you.

32.verse: You must not ·make an agreement [cut a covenant] with those people or with their gods.

33.verse: You must not let them live in your land, or they will make you sin against me. If you ·worship [serve] their gods, ·you will be caught in a trap [they will be a trap/snare to you].”

1.verse: God Makes a Covenant with Israel - The LORD told Moses, “You, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel must come up to me and ·worship [bow down to] me from a distance.

2.verse: Then Moses alone must come near me; the others must not come near. The rest of the people must not come up the mountain with Moses.”

3.verse: Moses ·told [went and recounted to] the people all the LORD’s words and ·laws for living [regulations; judgments]. Then all of the people answered out loud together, “We will do all the things the LORD has said.”

4.verse: So Moses wrote down all the words of the LORD. And he got up early the next morning and built an altar near the bottom of the mountain. He set up twelve ·stones [pillars], one ·stone [pillar] for each of the twelve tribes of Israel.

5.verse: Then Moses sent ·young Israelite men [youth of the sons/children of Israel] to offer whole burnt offerings and to sacrifice young bulls as ·fellowship [or peace; Lev. 3] offerings to the LORD.

6.verse: Moses put half of the blood of these animals in ·bowls [basins], and he ·sprinkled [or dashed] the other half of the blood on the altar.

7.verse: Then he took the Book of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty referring to the laws found in 20:2–23:19] and read it so the people could hear him. And they said, “We will do everything that the LORD has said; we will obey.”

8.verse: Then Moses took ·the blood from the bowls [the blood] and ·sprinkled [dashed] it on the people, saying, “This is the blood ·that begins [of] the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty], the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty] which the LORD ·has made [cut] with you ·about [or in accord with] all these words.”

9.verse: Moses, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel went up the mountain

10.verse: and saw the God of Israel. Under his feet was a ·surface [pavement] that looked as if it were paved with blue sapphire stones, and it was as clear as the ·sky [heavens]!

11.verse: These ·leaders of the Israelites [eminent men of the sons/children of Israel] saw God, but ·God did not destroy them [he did not send out his hand]. Then they ate and drank together [meals often sealed covenant/treaty agreements].

12.verse: God Promises Moses the Stone Tablets - The LORD said to Moses, “Come up the mountain to me. Wait there, and I will give you two stone tablets [perhaps two copies of the Ten Commandments]. On these are the ·teachings [laws; instructions] and the commands I have written to instruct the people.”

13.verse: So Moses and his ·helper [assistant] Joshua ·set out [got up], and Moses went up to ·Sinai, the mountain of God [the mountain of God].

14.verse: Moses said to the elders, “Wait here for us until we come back to you. Aaron and Hur are with you, and anyone who ·has a disagreement with others [has many words/a dispute; is a master of words] can take it to them.”

15.verse: Moses Meets with God - When Moses went up on the mountain, the cloud [representing God’s presence] covered it.

16.verse: The glory of the LORD [representing his manifest presence] ·came down [settled] on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days. On the seventh day the LORD called to Moses from inside the cloud.

17.verse: To the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] the glory of the LORD looked like a fire burning on top of the mountain.

18.verse: Then Moses went into the cloud and went higher up the mountain. He was on the mountain for forty days and forty nights.

1.verse: Gifts for the Lord - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Tell the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] to bring me ·gifts [tribute]. Receive for me the ·gifts [tribute] ·each person wants [from each one whose heart moves them] to give.

3.verse: ·These are the gifts [This is the tribute] that you should receive from them: gold, silver, bronze;

4.verse: blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread; fine linen, goat hair,

5.verse: ·sheepskins [or ramskins] that are dyed red; ·fine leather [or sea cow/porpoise hide]; acacia wood;

6.verse: olive oil to burn in the lamps; spices for sweet-smelling incense, and the special olive oil ·poured on a person’s head to make him a priest [for anointing; Ps. 133];

7.verse: onyx stones, and other jewels to be put on the ·holy vest [ephod; 28:6–14] and the ·chest covering [breastpiece; 28:15–30].

8.verse: “The people must build a ·holy place [sanctuary] for me so that I can live among them.

9.verse: Build this ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] and ·everything in it [all its furniture] by the ·plan [pattern] I will show you [every detail reflects a heavenly reality].

10.verse: The Ark of the Covenant - “·Use acacia wood and build an Ark [They will make an Ark of acacia wood; the Ark, considered the footstool of God’s throne, was a powerful symbol of God’s presence; 1 Sam. 4] ·forty-five inches [two and a half cubits] long, ·twenty-seven inches [a cubit and a half] wide, and ·twenty-seven inches [a cubit and a half] high.

11.verse: ·Cover the Ark [Overlay it] inside and out with pure gold, and put a gold ·strip [molding] all around it.

12.verse: ·Make [Cast] four gold rings for the Ark and attach them to its four feet, two rings on ·each [one side and two rings on the other] side.

13.verse: Then make poles from acacia wood and ·cover [cast; overlay] them with gold.

14.verse: Put the poles through the rings on the sides of the Ark, and use these poles to carry it.

15.verse: These poles must always stay in the rings of the Ark. Do not take them out.

16.verse: Then put in the Ark the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony] which I will make with you [a reference to the tablets of the Ten Commandments].

17.verse: “Then make the ·lid of the Ark [mercy seat; atonement cover] of pure gold. Make it ·forty-five inches [two and a half cubits] long and ·twenty-seven inches [one and a half cubits] wide.

18.verse: ·Then hammer gold to make two creatures with wings [Make two cherubim of hammered gold], and put one on each end of the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover].

19.verse: Attach one ·creature [cherub] on one end of the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover] and the other ·creature [cherub] on the other end. Make them to be one piece with the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover] at the ends.

20.verse: The ·creatures’ [cherubim’s] wings should be spread upward, covering the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover], and the ·creatures [cherubim] are to face each other across the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover].

21.verse: Put this ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover] on top of the Ark, and put in the Ark the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony] which I will make with you.

22.verse: I will meet with you there, above the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover] between the two ·winged creatures [cherubim] on the Ark of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony]. There I will give you all my commands for the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel].

23.verse: The Table - “Make a table out of acacia wood, ·thirty-six inches [two cubits] long, ·eighteen inches [one cubit] wide, and ·twenty-seven inches [one and a half cubits] high.

24.verse: ·Cover [Overlay] it with pure gold, and put a gold ·strip [molding] around it.

25.verse: Make a ·frame [rim] ·three inches [a handbreadth] high ·that stands up all around the edge, and put a gold ·strip [molding] around it.

26.verse: Then make four gold rings. Attach them to the four corners of the table where the four legs are.

27.verse: Put the rings close to the ·frame [rim] around the top of the table, because they will hold the poles for carrying it.

28.verse: Make the poles out of acacia wood, ·cover [overlay] them with gold, and carry the table with these poles.

29.verse: Make the plates and bowls for the table, as well as the jars and cups, out of pure gold. They will be used for pouring out the drink offerings [Ezra 1:9–11; Dan. 1:2; 5:1–4].

30.verse: On this table put the ·bread that shows you are in my presence [Bread of Presence] so that it is always there in front of me.

31.verse: The Lampstand - “Hammer pure gold to make a ·lampstand [menorah]. Its base, ·stand [shaft], flower-like cups, buds, and petals must all be joined together in one piece [its tree shape suggests that the Tabernacle represented Eden where God and humans lived in harmony].

32.verse: The lampstand must have six branches going out from its sides—three on one side and three on the other.

33.verse: Each branch must have three cups shaped like almond flowers on it. Each cup must have a bud and a petal. Each of the six branches going out from the lampstand must be the same.

34.verse: And there must be four more cups made like almond flowers on the lampstand itself. These cups must also have buds and petals.

35.verse: Put a bud under each pair of branches that goes out from the lampstand. Each of the six branches going out from the lampstand must be the same.

36.verse: The branches, buds, and lampstand must be made of one piece, hammered out of pure gold.

37.verse: “Then make seven ·small oil lamps [lamps for it] and put them on the lampstand so that they give light to the area in front of it.

38.verse: The ·wick trimmers [snuffers] and trays must be made of pure gold.

39.verse: Use ·seventy-five pounds [one talent] of pure gold to make the lampstand and everything with it.

40.verse: Be very careful to make them by the ·plan [pattern] I showed you on the mountain [25:9].

1.verse: The Holy Tent - “Make for the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] ten curtains of fine linen and blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread. Have a skilled craftsman sew designs of ·creatures with wings [cherubim; 37:7] on the pieces of cloth [these deep blue curtains with cherubim represent heaven on earth].

2.verse: Make each curtain the same size—·forty-two feet [twenty-eight cubits] long and ·six feet [four cubits] wide.

3.verse: ·Sew [Join; Bind] five curtains together for one set, and ·sew [join; bind] the other curtains together for the second set.

4.verse: Make loops of blue cloth on the edge of the end curtain of one set, and do the same for the end curtain of the other set.

5.verse: Make fifty loops on the end curtain of the first set and fifty loops on the end curtain of the second set. These loops must be opposite each other.

6.verse: And make fifty gold ·hooks [clasps] to join the two sets of curtains so that the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] is one piece.

7.verse: “Then make another tent that will cover the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], using eleven curtains made from goat hair.

8.verse: All these curtains must be the same size—·forty-five feet [thirty cubits] long and ·six [four cubits] feet wide.

9.verse: ·Sew [Join; Bind] five of the curtains together into one set. Then ·sew [join; bind] the other six curtains together into the second set. Fold the sixth curtain double over the front of the Tent.

10.verse: Make fifty loops down the edge of the end curtain of one set, and do the same for the end curtain of the other set.

11.verse: Then make fifty bronze ·hooks [clasps] and put them in the loops to ·join [bind] the tent together so that the covering is one piece.

12.verse: Let the extra half piece of cloth hang over the back of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle].

13.verse: There will be ·eighteen inches [one cubit] hanging over the sides of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], to ·protect [cover] it [this is the innermost of the weatherproofing protecting the innermost curtain].

14.verse: Make a covering for the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] from ·sheepskins colored red [or tanned rams’ skins; the second weatherproof covering], and over that make a covering from ·fine leather [or sea cow hide; the outermost covering used for weatherproofing].

15.verse: “Use acacia wood to make upright frames for the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle].

16.verse: Each frame must be ·fifteen feet [ten cubits] long and ·twenty-seven inches [a cubit and a half] wide,

17.verse: with two pegs side by side. Every frame [of the Holy Tent/Tabernacle] must be made the same way.

18.verse: Make twenty frames for the south side of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle].

19.verse: Each frame must have two silver bases to go under it, a peg fitting into each base. You must make forty silver bases for the [twenty] frames.

20.verse: Make twenty more frames for the [second side on the] north side of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle]

21.verse: and forty silver bases for them—two bases for each frame.

22.verse: You must make six frames for the rear or west end of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle]

23.verse: and two frames for each corner at the rear [of the Holy Tent/Tabernacle].

24.verse: The two frames are to be doubled at the bottom and joined at the top with a metal ring. Both corner frames must be made this way.

25.verse: So there will be a total of eight frames at the rear of the Tent, and there will be sixteen silver bases—two bases under each frame.

26.verse: “Make crossbars of acacia wood to connect the upright frames of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle]. Make five crossbars to hold the frames together on one side

27.verse: and five to hold the frames together on the ·other [second] side. Also make five crossbars to hold the frames together on the west end, at the rear.

28.verse: The middle crossbar is to be set halfway up the frames, and it is to run along the entire length of each side and rear.

29.verse: Make gold rings on the sides of the frames to hold the crossbars, and ·cover [overlay] the frames and the crossbars with gold.

30.verse: Set up the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] by the ·plan [pattern] shown to you on the mountain [25:9].

31.verse: “Make a curtain of fine linen and blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and have a skilled craftsman sew ·designs of creatures with wings [cherubim; 37:7] on it.

32.verse: ·Hang [Place] the curtain by gold ·hooks [clasps] on four posts of acacia wood that are ·covered [overlaid] with gold, and set them in four silver bases.

33.verse: ·Hang [Place] the curtain from the ·hooks [clasps] in the roof, and put the Ark of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony; 25:10] containing the two stone tablets [24:12] behind it. This curtain will separate the ·Holy Place [Tabernacle] from the ·Most Holy Place [Holy of Holies; the back third, the throne room of God].

34.verse: Put the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover; 25:13–22] on the Ark of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony; 25:10] in the Most Holy Place.

35.verse: “Outside the curtain, put the table [25:23–30] on the north side of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle]. Put the lampstand [25:31–40] on the south side of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] across from the table.

36.verse: The Entrance of the Holy Tent - “Then, for the entrance of the Tent, make a ·curtain [screen] with fine linen and blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread. ·Someone who can sew well is to sew designs on it […embroidered with needlework].

37.verse: Make five posts of acacia wood ·covered [overlaid] with gold. Make gold ·hooks [clasps] for them on which to hang the ·curtain [screen], and make five bronze bases for them.

1.verse: The Altar for the Burnt Offerings - “Make an altar of acacia wood, ·four and one-half feet [three cubits] high. It should be square—·seven and one-half feet [five cubits] long and ·seven and one-half feet [five cubits] wide.

2.verse: Make each of the four corners of the altar stick out like a horn [significance uncertain, but refers to rounded projections on each corner of top; 29:10–12; Lev. 4:18–21; 1 Kin. 2:28–34], in such a way that the corners with their horns are all one piece. Then ·cover [overlay] the whole altar with bronze.

3.verse: “Use bronze to make all ·the tools and dishes that will be used on the altar [its utensils]: the pots to remove the ashes, the shovels, the ·bowls for sprinkling blood [basins], the meat forks, and the ·pans for carrying the burning wood [firepans].

4.verse: “Make a large bronze screen to hold the burning wood, and put a bronze ring at each of the four corners of it.

5.verse: Put the screen inside the altar, under its ·rim [ledge], halfway up from the bottom [of the altar].

6.verse: “Make poles of acacia wood for the altar, and ·cover [overlay] them with bronze.

7.verse: Put the poles through the rings on both sides of the altar to carry it.

8.verse: Make the altar out of boards and leave the inside hollow. Make it as you were shown on the mountain [25:9].

9.verse: The Courtyard of the Holy Tent - “Make ·a wall of curtains to form a courtyard around the Holy Tent [the court of the Tabernacle]. The south side should have a wall of fine linen curtains ·one hundred fifty feet [one hundred cubits] long.

10.verse: Hang the curtains with silver hooks and bands on twenty bronze ·posts [pillars] with twenty bronze bases.

11.verse: The north side must also be ·one hundred fifty feet [one hundred cubits] long. Hang its curtains on silver hooks and bands on twenty bronze ·posts [pillars] with twenty bronze bases.

12.verse: “The west end of the courtyard must have a wall of curtains ·seventy-five feet [fifty cubits] long, with ten ·posts [pillars] and ten bases on that wall.

13.verse: The [front on the] east end of the courtyard must also be ·seventy-five feet [fifty cubits] long.

14.verse: On one side of the entry, there is to be a wall of curtains ·twenty-two and one-half feet [fifteen cubits] long, held up by three ·posts [pillars] on three bases.

15.verse: On the other side of the entry, there is also to be a wall of curtains ·twenty-two and one-half feet [fifteen cubits] long, held up by three ·posts [pillars] on three bases.

16.verse: “The ·entry [gate] to the courtyard is to be a ·curtain [screen] ·thirty feet [twenty cubits] wide, made of fine linen with blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread. ·Someone who can sew well is to sew designs on it […embroidered with needlework]. It is to be held up by four ·posts [pillars] on four bases.

17.verse: All the ·posts [pillars] around the courtyard must have silver bands and hooks and bronze bases.

18.verse: The courtyard must be ·one hundred fifty feet [one hundred cubits] long and ·seventy-five feet [fifty cubits] wide, with a wall of curtains around it ·seven and one-half feet [five cubits] high, made of fine linen. The bases in which the ·posts [pillars] are set must be bronze.

19.verse: All the ·things used in the Holy Tent [utensils of the Tabernacle] and all the tent pegs for the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] and the wall around the courtyard must be made of bronze.

20.verse: Oil for the Lamp - “Command the ·people [sons/children] of Israel to bring you pure olive oil, made from ·pressed [or pounded] olives, to keep the lamps on the lampstand burning [regularly; or continually].

21.verse: Aaron and his sons must keep the lamps burning before the LORD from evening till morning. This will be in the Meeting Tent, outside the curtain which is in front of the ·Ark [Covenant; Testimony; Treaty]. The Israelites and their descendants must obey this ·rule [statute; ordinance; requirement] ·from now on [throughout their generations].

1.verse: Clothes for the Priests - “·Tell your brother Aaron to come [Bring near your brother Aaron] to you, along with his sons Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar. ·Separate them from the other Israelites to […to] serve me as priests.

2.verse: Make holy ·clothes [garments; vestments] for your brother Aaron to give him ·honor [glory] and ·beauty [splendor].

3.verse: Tell all the ·skilled craftsmen to whom I have given wisdom [the wise of heart whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom; wisdom here is a practical knowledge, a skill] to make ·special clothes [garments; vestments] for Aaron—clothes to show that he ·belongs to me [is consecrated/set apart/ holy] so that he may serve me as a priest.

4.verse: These are the clothes they must make: a ·chest covering [breastpiece], a ·holy vest [ephod], an outer robe, a ·woven inner [or checkered] robe, a turban, and a ·cloth belt [sash]. They must make these ·holy [sacred] clothes for your brother Aaron and his sons. Then they may serve me as priests.

5.verse: They must use gold and blue, purple and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen.

6.verse: The Holy Vest - “Use gold and blue, purple and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen to make the ·holy vest [ephod]; ·skilled craftsmen are to make it [skillfully worked].

7.verse: At each top corner of it there will be a pair of shoulder straps tied together over each shoulder.

8.verse: “·The craftsmen will very carefully weave a belt [The embroidered waistband] on the ·holy vest that is [ephod will be] made with the same materials—gold and blue, purple and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen.

1.verse: Rules About the Sabbath - Moses ·gathered [assembled] all the ·Israelite community [congregation/assembly of the sons/children of Israel] together and said to them, “·These are the things [This is the word/thing] the LORD has commanded you to do.

5.verse: From what you have, take ·an offering [tribute] for the LORD. Let everyone ·who is willing [whose heart moves them] bring this ·offering [tribute] to the LORD: gold, silver, bronze,

6.verse: blue, purple and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen, goat hair

27.verse: The leaders brought onyx stones and other jewels ·to put on the holy vest [for the ephod; 28:6–14] and ·chest covering for the priest [breastpiece; 28:15–28].

29.verse: All the men and women of Israel ·who wanted [whose hearts were favorable] to help brought ·gifts [a free will offering] to the LORD for all the work the LORD had commanded Moses and the people to do.

35.verse: The LORD has ·given them [filled them with] the skill to do all kinds of work. They are able to ·cut [engrave] designs in metal and stone. They can plan and ·sew designs [embroider] in the fine linen with the blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread. And they are alsoable to weave things.

1.verse: So Bezalel, Oholiab, and every ·skilled [wise of heart/mind] person will do the work the LORD has commanded, because he gave them the wisdom and understanding to do all the skilled work needed to build the Holy ·Tent [Place].”

2.verse: Then Moses called Bezalel, Oholiab, and all the other ·skilled [wise of heart/mind] people to whom the LORD had given ·skills [wisdom in their heart], and they came because ·they wanted [their hearts were favorable] to help with the work.

36.verse: They made four posts of acacia wood for it and ·covered [overlaid] them with gold. Then they made gold ·hooks [clasps] for the posts, as well as four silver bases in which to set the posts.

37.verse: For the entrance to the Tent, they made a ·curtain [screen] of blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen. ·A person who sewed well sewed designs on it […embroidered with needlework].

38.verse: Then they made five posts and ·hooks [clasps] for it. They covered the tops of the posts and their bands with gold, and they made five bronze bases for the posts.

1.verse: The Ark of the Covenant - Bezalel made the Ark of acacia wood; it was ·forty-five inches [two and a half cubits] long, ·twenty-seven inches [one and a half cubits] wide, and twenty-seven inches [one and a half cubits] high.

5.verse: He put the poles through the rings on each side of the Ark to carry it.

6.verse: Then he made a ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover] of pure gold that was ·forty-five inches [two and a half cubits] long and ·twenty-seven inches [one and a half cubits] wide.

7.verse: Then Bezalel ·hammered gold to make two creatures with wings [made two golden cherubim of hammered gold; cherubim are powerful angelic creatures] and attached them to each end of the ·lid [cover; the mercy seat].

9.verse: The ·creatures’ [cherubim’s] wings were spread upward, covering the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover], and the ·creatures [cherubim] faced each other across the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover].

10.verse: The Table - Then he made the table of acacia wood; it was ·thirty-six inches [two cubits] long, ·eighteen inches [one cubit] wide, and ·twenty-seven inches [one and a half cubits] high.

11.verse: He ·covered [overlaid] it with pure gold and put a gold ·strip [molding] around it.

12.verse: He made a ·frame [rim] ·three inches [a handbreadth] high ·that stood up all around the edge [all around it], and he put a gold ·strip [molding] around it.

13.verse: Then he made four gold rings for the table and attached them to the four corners of the table where the four legs were.

14.verse: The rings were put close to the ·frame [rim] around the top of the table, because they held the poles for carrying it.

15.verse: The poles for carrying the table were made of acacia wood and were ·covered [overlaid] with gold.

16.verse: He made of pure gold all the ·things [vessels] that were used on the table: the plates, bowls, cups, and jars used for pouring the drink offerings [Ezra 1:9–11; Dan. 1:2; 5:1–4].

17.verse: The Lampstand - Then he made the ·lampstand [Menorah] of pure gold, hammering out its base and ·stand [shaft]. Its flower-like cups, buds, and petals were joined together in one piece with the base and ·stand [shaft; 25:31].

18.verse: Six branches went out from the sides of the lampstand—three on one side and three on the other.

19.verse: Each branch had three cups shaped like almond flowers, and each cup had a bud and a petal. Each of the six branches going out from the lampstand was the same.

20.verse: There were four more cups shaped like almond flowers on the lampstand itself, each with its buds and petals.

21.verse: Three pairs of branches went out from the lampstand. A bud was under the place where each pair was attached to the lampstand. Each of the six branches going out from the lampstand was the same.

22.verse: The buds, branches, and lampstand were all one piece of pure, hammered gold.

23.verse: He made seven pure gold lamps for this lampstand, and he made pure gold ·wick trimmers [snuffers] and trays.

24.verse: He used about ·seventy-five pounds [one talent] of pure gold to make the lampstand and all the things that go with it.

25.verse: The Altar for Burning Incense - Then he made the altar of incense out of acacia wood. It was square—·eighteen inches [one cubit] long and ·eighteen inches [one cubit] wide—and it was ·thirty-six inches [two cubits] high. Each ·corner that stuck out like a horn [horn; 27:2] was joined into one piece with the altar.

26.verse: He ·covered [overlaid] the top and all the sides and the ·corners [horns] with pure gold, and he put gold ·trim [molding] around the altar

27.verse: He made two gold rings and put them below the ·trim [molding] on opposite sides of it; these rings held the poles for carrying it.

28.verse: He made the poles of acacia wood and ·covered [overlaid] them with gold.

29.verse: Then he made the holy olive oil for ·appointing the priests [anointing] and the pure, sweet-smelling incense. He made them like a person who mixes perfumes.

1.verse: The Altar for Burnt Offerings - Then he built the altar for burnt offerings [Lev. 1] out of acacia wood. The altar was square—·seven and one-half feet [five cubits] long and ·seven and one-half feet [five cubits] wide—and it was ·four and one-half feet [three cubits] high.

2.verse: He made each corner stick out like a horn [27:2] so that the horns and the altar were joined together in one piece. Then he ·covered [overlaid] the altar with bronze.

3.verse: He made all the ·tools [utensils] of bronze to use on the altar: the pots, shovels, ·bowls for sprinkling blood [basins], meat forks, and ·pans for carrying the fire [firepans].

4.verse: He made a large bronze screen to hold the burning wood for the altar and put it inside the altar, under its ·rim [ledge], halfway up from the bottom.

5.verse: He made bronze rings to hold the poles for carrying the altar, and he put them at the four corners of the screen.

6.verse: Then he made poles of acacia wood and ·covered [overlaid] them with bronze.

7.verse: He put the poles through the rings on both sides of the altar, to carry it. He made the altar of boards and left the inside hollow.

8.verse: The Bronze Bowl - He made the bronze ·bowl for washing [basin], and he built it on a bronze stand. He used the bronze from mirrors that belonged to the women who served at the entrance to the Meeting Tent.

9.verse: The Courtyard of the Holy Tent - Then he made ·a wall of curtains to form a courtyard around the Holy Tent [the court]. On the south side the curtains were ·one hundred fifty feet [one hundred cubits] long and were made of fine linen.

10.verse: The curtains hung on silver hooks and bands, placed on twenty bronze ·posts [pillars] with twenty bronze bases.

11.verse: On the north side the wall of curtains was also ·one hundred fifty feet [one hundred cubits] long, and it hung on silver hooks and bands on twenty ·posts [pillars] with twenty bronze bases.

12.verse: On the west side of the courtyard, the wall of curtains was ·seventy-five feet [fifty cubits] long. It was held up by silver hooks and bands on ten ·posts [pillars] with ten bases.

13.verse: The [front of the] east side was also ·seventy-five feet [fifty cubits] long.

14.verse: On one side of the entry there was a wall of curtains ·twenty-two and one-half feet [fifteen cubits] long, held up by three ·posts [pillars] and three bases.

15.verse: On the other side of the entry there was also a wall of curtains ·twenty-two and one-half feet [fifteen cubits] long, held up by three ·posts [pillars] and three bases.

16.verse: All the curtains around the courtyard were made of fine linen.

17.verse: The bases for the ·posts [pillars] were made of bronze. The hooks and the bands on the ·posts [pillars] were made of silver, and the tops of the ·posts [pillars] were ·covered [overlaid] with silver also. All the ·posts [pillars] in the courtyard had silver bands.

18.verse: The ·curtain [screen] for the ·entry [gate] of the courtyard was made of blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen, ·sewn by a person who could sew well [embroidered with needlework]. The curtain was ·thirty feet [twenty cubits] long and ·seven and one-half feet [five cubits] high, the same height as the curtains around the courtyard.

19.verse: It was held up by four ·posts [pillars] and four bronze bases. The hooks and bands on the posts were made of silver, and the tops on the ·posts [pillars] were ·covered [overlaid] with silver.

20.verse: All the tent pegs for the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] and for the curtains around the courtyard were made of bronze.

21.verse: This is a ·list of the materials used to make [inventory; record of] the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] ·where the Agreement was kept [of the Covenant/Testimony/Treaty; reference to the tablets of the Ten Commandments; ch. 20]. Moses ordered the Levites to make this list, ·and Ithamar son of Aaron was in charge of keeping it [by the hand of Ithama son of Aaron].

22.verse: Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur of the tribe of Judah, made everything the LORD commanded Moses.

23.verse: Oholiab son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan ·helped [was with] him. He ·could cut designs into metal and stone; he was a designer and also skilled at sewing [was an engraver, designer, and embroiderer of] the blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen.

24.verse: The total amount of gold used to build the Holy ·Tent [Place] was ·presented [offered as a wave offering] to the LORD. It weighed over ·2,000 pounds [29 talents and 730 shekels], as set by the Holy Place measure.

25.verse: The silver was given by the ·members of the community [congregation; assembly] who were counted. It weighed ·7,550 pounds [100 talents and 1,775 shekels], as set by the Holy Place measure.

26.verse: All the men twenty years old or older were counted. There were 603,550 men, and each ·man [head] had to pay ·one-fifth of an ounce [a beka, that is half a shekel] of silver, as set by the Holy Place measure.

27.verse: Of this silver, ·7,500 pounds [100 talents] were used to ·make [cast] the one hundred bases for the Holy Tent and for the curtain—·75 pounds of silver [a talent] in each base.

28.verse: They used ·50 pounds of silver [1775 shekels] to make the hooks for the ·posts [pillars] and to ·cover [overlay] the tops of the ·posts [pillars] and to make the bands on them.

29.verse: The bronze which was ·presented [offered as a wave offering] to the LORD weighed about ·5,000 pounds [70 talents and 2400 shekels].

30.verse: They used ·the bronze to make the bases at the entrance of the Meeting Tent, to make the altar and the bronze ·screen [grating], and to make all the ·tools [utensils] for the altar.

31.verse: ·This bronze was also used to make […and the] bases for the wall of curtains around the courtyard and bases for curtains at the ·entry [gate] to the courtyard, as well as to make the tent pegs for the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] and the pegs around the courtyard.

1.verse: Clothes for the Priests - They used blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread to make woven clothes for the priests to wear when they ·served [ministered] in the Holy Place. They made the holy clothes for Aaron as the LORD had commanded Moses.

2.verse: They made the ·holy vest [ephod] of gold, and blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen [28:6–14].

3.verse: They hammered the gold into sheets and then cut it into long, thin strips. They worked the gold into the blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen. This was done ·by skilled craftsmen [or with a skilled design].

4.verse: They made the shoulder straps for the ·holy vest [ephod], which were attached to the top corners of it and tied together over each shoulder.

5.verse: The skillfully ·woven belt [embroidered waistband] was made in the same way; it was joined to ·the holy vest [it] as one piece. It was made of gold, and blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen, the way the LORD commanded Moses.

6.verse: They put gold [filigree] around the onyx stones and then ·wrote [engraved] the names of the sons of Israel on these gems, ·as a person carves words and designs on a seal [like the engravings on a seal/signet].

7.verse: Then they attached the gems on the shoulder straps of the ·holy vest [ephod], as reminders of the twelve sons of Israel. This was done just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

8.verse: ·The skilled craftsmen [They] made the ·chest covering [breastpiece] like the ·holy vest [ephod]; it was made of gold, and blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen.

9.verse: ·The chest covering [It] was square—·nine inches [a span] long and ·nine inches [a span] wide—and it was ·folded double to make a pocket [doubled].

10.verse: Then they put four rows of ·beautiful jewels [stones] on it: In the first row there was a ·ruby [or carnelian], a ·topaz [or chrysolite], and a ·yellow quartz [or emerald];

11.verse: in the second there was a turquoise, a ·sapphire [or lapis], and an ·emerald [or moonstone];

12.verse: in the third there was a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;

13.verse: in the fourth there was a ·chrysolite [or beryl], an onyx, and a jasper [identification is uncertain]. Gold [filigree] was put around these ·jewels [stones] to attach them to the ·chest covering [breastpiece],

14.verse: and the names of the sons of Israel were ·carved [engraved] on these twelve ·jewels [stones] as a person ·carves [engraves] a ·seal [signet]. Each ·jewel [stone] had the name of one of the twelve tribes of Israel.

15.verse: They made chains of pure gold, twisted together like a rope, for the ·chest covering [breastpiece].

16.verse: They made two gold pieces and two gold rings. They put the two gold rings on the two upper corners of the ·chest covering [breastpiece].

17.verse: Then they put two gold chains in the two rings at the ends of the ·chest covering [breastpiece],

18.verse: and they fastened the other two ends of the chains to the two ·gold pieces [or settings]. They attached these gold pieces to the two shoulder straps in the front of the ·holy vest [ephod].

19.verse: They made two gold rings and put them at the lower corners of the ·chest covering [breastpiece] on the inside edge next to the ·holy vest [ephod].

20.verse: They made two more gold rings on the bottom of the shoulder straps in front of the ·holy vest [ephod], near the seam, just above the ·woven belt [embroidered waistband] of the ·holy vest [ephod].

21.verse: They used a blue ·ribbon [cord] and tied the rings of the ·chest covering [breastpiece] to the rings of the ·holy vest [ephod], connecting it to the ·woven belt [embroidered waistband]. In this way the ·chest covering [breastpiece] would not ·swing out [get loose] from the ·holy vest [ephod]. They did all these things the way the LORD commanded.

22.verse: Then they made the outer robe ·to be worn under the holy vest [of the ephod]. It was woven only of blue cloth.

23.verse: They made a ·hole [opening] in the center of the outer robe, with a woven collar ·sewn around it [like a coat of mail; the Hebrew is obscure] so it would not tear.

24.verse: Then they made balls like pomegranates of blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread, and fine linen and hung them around the bottom of the outer robe.

25.verse: They also made bells of pure gold and hung these around the bottom of the outer robe between the balls.

26.verse: So around the bottom of the outer robe there was a bell and a pomegranate ball, a bell and a pomegranate ball. The priest wore this outer robe when he ·served as priest [ministered], just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

27.verse: They ·wove [made] inner robes of fine linen for Aaron and his sons,

28.verse: and they made turbans, ·headbands [headdresses], and underclothes of fine linen.

29.verse: Then they made the ·cloth belt [sash] of fine linen, and blue, purple, and ·red [scarlet] thread·, and designs were sewn onto it [embroidered with needlework], just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

30.verse: They made a ·strip [rosette; medallion; plate; flower] of pure gold, which is the holy ·crown [diadem], and ·carved [engraved] these words in the gold, as one might ·carve [engrave] on a ·seal [signet]: “Holy to the LORD.”

31.verse: Then they tied ·this flat piece [a blue cord to it to fasten it] to the turban with a blue ribbon, as the LORD had commanded Moses.

32.verse: So all the work on the [Tabernacle of the] Meeting Tent was finished. The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] did everything just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

33.verse: Then they brought the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] to Moses: the Tent and all its furniture, hooks, frames, crossbars, ·posts [pillars], and bases;

34.verse: the covering made of male ·sheepskins [ramskins] colored red, the covering made of ·fine leather [sea cow/porpoise hide], and the curtain ·that covered the entrance to the Most Holy Place [for the screen];

35.verse: the Ark of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony; 25:10], its poles and ·lid [the mercy seat/atonement cover; 25:17–22];

36.verse: the table [25:23–40], all its ·containers [utensils; tools], and the bread ·that showed they were in God’s presence [of presence];

37.verse: the pure ·gold lampstand [Menorah; 25:31–40] with its lamps in a row, all its ·tools [utensils], and the olive oil for the light;

38.verse: the gold altar [the incense altar; 30:1–6], the special olive oil used for ·appointing priests [anointing], the sweet-smelling incense, and the ·curtain that covered [screen at] the entrance to the Tent;

39.verse: the bronze altar [27:1–8] and its ·screen [bronze grating], its poles and all its ·tools [utensils], the bowl and its stand [30:17–21];

40.verse: the curtains for the courtyard with their ·posts [pillars] and bases, the ·curtain that covered the entry to [screen for the gate of] the courtyard, the cords, pegs, and all the ·things [utensils for service] in the Meeting Tent.

41.verse: They brought the clothes for the priests to wear when they ·served [ministered] in the Holy ·Tent [Place]—the ·holy [sacred] clothes for Aaron the priest and the clothes for his sons, which they wore when they served as priests.

42.verse: The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] had done all this work just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

43.verse: Moses looked closely at all the work and saw they had done it just as the LORD had commanded. So Moses blessed them.

1.verse: Setting Up the Holy Tent - Then the LORD said to Moses:

2.verse: “On the first day of the first month, set up the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], which is the Meeting Tent.

3.verse: Put the Ark of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony; 25:10] in it and ·hang the curtain in front of the Ark [screen the Ark with a curtain].

4.verse: Bring in the table [25:23–30] and arrange ·everything on the table that should be there [its setting]. Then bring in the ·lampstand [Menorah; 25:31–40] and set up its lamps.

5.verse: Put the gold altar for ·burning incense [offering smoke; 30:1–6] in front of the Ark of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony], and put the ·curtain [screen] at the entrance to the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle].

6.verse: “Put the altar of burnt offerings [27:1–8] in front of the entrance of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], the Meeting Tent.

7.verse: Put the bowl [30:17–21] between the Meeting Tent and the altar, and put water in it.

8.verse: Set up the courtyard ·around the Holy Tent [all around], and put the ·curtain [screen] at the ·entry [gate] to the courtyard.

9.verse: “Use the ·special [anointing] olive oil and ·pour it on [anoint] the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] and everything in it, in order to ·give the Tent and all that is in it for service to the LORD [sanctify/consecrate it and all its utensils/tools]. They will be holy.

10.verse: ·Pour the special oil on [Anoint] the altar for burnt offerings and on all its ·tools [utensils]. ·Give the altar for service to God [Consecrate/Sanctify the altar], and it will be ·very holy [a holy of holies].

11.verse: Then ·pour the special olive oil on [anoint] the bowl and the base under it so that they will be ·given for service to God [consecrated; sanctified].

12.verse: “Bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the Meeting Tent, and wash them with water.

13.verse: Then put the ·holy [sacred] clothes on Aaron. ·Pour the special oil on [Anoint] him [Ps. 133], and ·give him for service to God [consecrate/sanctify him] so that he may serve me as a priest.

14.verse: Bring his sons and put the inner robes [28:39–41] on them.

15.verse: ·Pour the special oil on [Anoint] them in the same way that you ·appointed [anointed] their father as priest so that they may also serve me as priests. ·Pouring oil on [Anointing] them will make them a family of priests, they and their descendants ·from now on [throughout their generations].”

16.verse: Moses did everything that the LORD commanded him.

17.verse: So the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] was set up on the first day of the first month during the second ·year after they left Egypt [year].

18.verse: When Moses set up the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], he put the bases in place, and he put the frames on the bases. Next he put ·the crossbars through the rings of the frames [in the poles] and set up the ·posts [pillars].

19.verse: After that, Moses spread ·the cloth over the Holy Tent [the tent over the Tabernacle] and put the covering over it, just as the LORD commanded.

20.verse: Moses put the ·stone tablets that had the Agreement written on them [Covenant; Testimony; Treaty] into the Ark. He put the poles ·through the rings of [on] the Ark and put the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover] on it.

21.verse: Next he brought the Ark into the ·Tent [Tabernacle] and hung the curtain to ·cover [screen] the Ark [of the Testimony], just as the LORD commanded him.

22.verse: Moses put the table in the Meeting Tent on the north side of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] in front of the curtain.

23.verse: Then he ·put [arranged] the bread ·on the table [in rows] before the LORD, just as the LORD commanded him.

24.verse: Moses put the lampstand [Menorah] in the Meeting Tent on the south side of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] across from the table.

25.verse: Then he put the lamps on the lampstand before the LORD, just as the LORD commanded him.

26.verse: Moses put the gold altar for burning incense in the Meeting Tent in front of the curtain.

27.verse: Then he ·burned [turned into smoke] sweet-smelling incense on it, just as the LORD commanded him.

28.verse: Then he hung the ·curtain [screen] at the entrance to the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle].

29.verse: He put the altar for burnt offerings [Lev. 1] at the entrance to the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], the Meeting Tent, and offered a whole burnt offering and ·grain [gift; tribute; Lev. 3] offerings on it, just as the LORD commanded him.

30.verse: Moses put the bowl [30:17–21] between the Meeting Tent and the altar for burnt offerings, and he put water in it for washing.

31.verse: Moses, Aaron, and Aaron’s sons used this water to wash their hands and feet [cleansing rituals].

32.verse: They washed themselves every time they entered the Meeting Tent and every time they went near the altar for burnt offerings, just as the LORD commanded Moses.

33.verse: Then Moses set up the courtyard around the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] and the altar, and he put up the ·curtain [screen] at the entry to the courtyard. So Moses finished the work.

34.verse: The Cloud over the Holy Tent - Then the cloud covered the Meeting Tent [representing God’s presence], and the glory of the LORD filled the Holy Tent [representing his manifest presence].

35.verse: Moses could not enter the Meeting Tent, because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the LORD filled the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle].

36.verse: When the cloud rose from the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle], the Israelites would begin to travel,

37.verse: but as long as the cloud ·stayed on the Holy Tent [did not rise], they did not travel. They stayed in that place until the cloud rose.

38.verse: So the cloud of the LORD was over the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] during the day, and there was a fire in the cloud at night. So all the ·Israelites [house of Israel] could see the cloud while they traveled.
